doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 19 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 195 [Air Date: 5/7/1986]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 19 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 195 [Air Date: 5/7/1986]

Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. Proposed immigration ban for AIDS infected persons2. Bunceton, Missouri, openly gay mayor Gene Ulrich elected to fourth term3. Seattle, lawyers guild attempts to block anti-gay activists from repealing protective ordinance, Council of Churches supports gay civil rights4. Andy Humm on censoring yourself and gay liberationCOMMERCIAL: Urban General Warehouse sale5. Interview with Connie Cohrt of the Greater Gotham Business Council6. ICN, makers of Ribavirin, artificially inflated price of the drug in Mexico7. Texas, first national AIDS hospital plans approved8. National Cancer Institute renders AIDS virus harmless in the lab9. Houston, Texas, council advises against health card proposalCOMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp10. Sports Report11. Outreach: Conversations with GMHC: Doug Marcino, a volunteer in the Speaker's Bureau of GMHC's Education Department, on providing informational outreach about GMHC12. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff BixbyCOMMERCIAL: E-Z Trim exercise equipment2. Interview with author Gordon Merrick on his book "A Measure of Madness"COMMERCIAL: The Monster3. Review of "Desert Hearts" filmCOMMERCIAL: NGTF Fund for Human Dignity with Dear Abby4. Interview with organizers of "Hocus Pocus" fundraiser event for children with AIDS, cuts off
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 19 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 195 [Air Date: 5/7/1986]: May 1986
